Class Match

  • java.lang.Object
    • Match

  • public class Match
extends Object
    The Match class is used to create and modify matches. Clubs objects build the match and player objects are used to create match results. The match class updates these two classes based on the results of a game.
    Author:
    Gary Carr

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Match(League l)
      The constructor for Match class creates an empty match, and initializes the scores at zero and sets match played to false

    • Constructor Detail

      • Match

        public Match(League l)
        The constructor for Match class creates an empty match, and initializes the scores at zero and sets match played to false
        Parameters:
        l - This requires a league object, the match will then belong to that league

    • Method Detail

      • checkFixtureDate

        public boolean checkFixtureDate(Calendar fixture)
        This method tests whether the date is in the past or the future. This is used to ensure that a match date cannot be set for a previous date
        Parameters:
        fixture - This parameter takes in a date from setFixtureMethod
        Returns:
        Returns boolean true if the date is in the past, and false if the date is in the future

      • confirmMatchResult

        public void confirmMatchResult(Match m,
                      League l)
        This method completes the game. An if statement compares the goal tally of each team from the game and assigns the result accordingly. The points tally of the teams and statistics are updated and the user is given a text output of the result. The match is moved from the fixtures to pastFixtures ArrayList in league and finally the matchPlayed boolean is updated to show the match is complete and cannot be edited further
        Parameters:
        m - This match is taken as a parameter so that methods for the league fixtures can be updated
        l - This is the league the match belongs to

      • displayScorersfromMatch

        public String displayScorersfromMatch()
        Method prints out a display of the goal scorers from the match from the scoredInMatch hashmap
        Returns:
        Returns a list of the scorers from this match

      • getATeamPlayerObject

        public Player getATeamPlayerObject(int selectPlayer,
                          Match m)
        Method is accessed from the League IO class. A user inputs the away team player they wish to select and then this method maps it to the player in the ArrayList and returns the player.
        Parameters:
        selectPlayer - This selects a player object, based on a number selection from the console IO
        m - This is the match which is being modified
        Returns:
        Returns the player selected from the arrayList

        Method returns the current size of the team
        Returns:
        Returns an int of the current size of the home team

      • getFinalResult

        public String getFinalResult()
        Method returns final score. The method is only used for unit testing and not called upon by the console IO
        Returns:
        Returns the result of the game (win/draw/lose).

      • getFinalScore

        public String getFinalScore()
        Method returns final score. The method is only used for unit testing and not called upon by the console IO
        Returns:
        Returns the final score of the game.

        public boolean isPlayerInATeam(Player player)

        Returns:

      • returnMatchPlayed

        public boolean returnMatchPlayed()
        Method determines if a match has already been played and returns true or false
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean stating if the match has been played yet

      • selectAwayPlayerForTeam

        public void selectAwayPlayerForTeam(Player player)
        The method selects a player for inclusion in the the home team, and checks they are not a duplicated entry. If the checks are okay the player is added to the home team
        Parameters:
        player - This tests a player object

      • selectGoalsScorers

        public void selectGoalsScorers(Player player,
                      int gscored)
        Method adds the goals scored to the match. The goals are then added to their total tally, to the clubs total tally, to the match tally for that club, and stored in a hashmap so that they can be recorded for future display.
        Parameters:
        player - This takes a player object selected by the user
        gscored - User inputs how many goals the player scored in the game

      • selectHomePlayerForTeam

        public void selectHomePlayerForTeam(Player player)
        The method selects a player for inclusion in the the home team, and checks they are not a duplicated entry. If the checks are okay the player is added to the home team
        Parameters:
        player - This tests a player object

      • setFixtureDate

        public void setFixtureDate(int date,
                  int month,
                  int year,
                  int hour,
                  int minute,
                  League l,
                  Match m)
        Methods creates a fixture date for the match and sets it to Calender timeAndDate. The date is then passed to the checkFixtureDate method and checked the date is in the future. If not the user is asked to input once more until the date is set. Format is then used to display the date correctly as a string
        Parameters:
        date - This takes the user inputted date of the match
        month - This takes the user inputted month of the match
        year - This takes the user inputted year of the match
        minute - This takes the user inputted minute the match starts
        hour - This takes the user inputted hour the match starts

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(String location)
        Method sets the stadium location for the match
        Parameters:
        location - This takes an inputted new stadium for the match to be played

      • setMatch

        public void setMatch(Match m,
            Club homeTeam,
            Club awayTeam,
            League l)
        This method takes 2 club objects and performs checks to ensure they are . Then it is verified a user hasn't tried to enter the same club twice. If both of these checks are okay then the teams are set, the home teams stadium is assigned as the location. The match is added to the leagues future fixture list and finally the away team is entered into the home teams ArrayList of homeMatches
        Parameters:
        m - This is the match that the user is currently modifying. It is a parameter itself so that it can be added to the leagues fixtures
        homeTeam - This is the club object selected to be the home team
        awayTeam - This is the club object selected to be the away team
        l - This is the league that the clubs belong to

      • showMatchPlayers

        public String showMatchPlayers(int x,
                      Match m,
                      League l)
        Method lists the players who played in this match. The int variable comes from the league IO where the user has selected if they want to view the home or away team
        Parameters:
        x - This int is inputted through the console IO
        m - This is the match that is being viewed
        l - This is the league the match belongs to
        Returns:
        Returns a print out of the players who played in the match

      • testMatch

        public static void testMatch()
        This is a testing method to test the above methods work. Each test gives in text what the answer should be, a demonstration of the answer, and then a coding test to ensure that Java confirms the answers are correct

      • toString

        public String toString()
        This toString method is set to return 2 different strings depending on whether the game has been played. An if statement tests and then makes small changes in the formatting e.g. if the match has been displayed will display result, if not will just state when it is to be played
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        Returns a string of text with the match details
